item.title: Error Page
item.description: After Dark includes an animated 404 Page you can display when other pages cannot be found. The error page contains a full-screen background animation and “404” link with Ginsu treatment. Following the link navigates to the homepage. Interactive Example
item.content:encoded: After Dark includes an animated 404 Page you can display when other pages cannot be found. The error page contains a full-screen background animation and &ldquo;404&rdquo; link with Ginsu treatment. Following the link navigates to the homepage. Interactive Example Adjust it from 404.html in the site content directory: ├── archetypes ├── content │ ├── post │ └── 404.html ├── layouts If the file doesn&rsquo;t exist yet, copy it from the theme default: $ cp themes/after-dark/content/404.html content Configure your web server to redirect to 404.html when pages cannot be found to use it. Combine with Voyeur Module for help creating Page Aliases.

item.title: Skin Styles
item.description: After Dark uses hackcss to provide four color palettes and two display modes. item.content:encoded: After Dark uses hackcss to provide four color palettes and two display modes. Toggle between them from your site configuration for 8 possible combinations: table[summary] td pre { margin: 0; } .hack.dark table tr:nth-child(odd) td { background-color: initial; } Palette Mode Hack Standard Dark None required. [params.hackcss] mode = &quot;standard&quot; Dark Grey [params.hackcss] palette = &quot;dark-grey&quot; [params.hackcss] mode = &quot;standard&quot; palette = &quot;dark-grey&quot; Solarized Dark [params.hackcss] palette = &quot;solarized-dark&quot; [params.hackcss] mode = &quot;standard&quot; palette = &quot;solarized-dark&quot; Light [params.hackcss] palette = &quot;light&quot; [params.hackcss] mode = &quot;standard&quot; palette = &quot;light&quot; The default skin uses the dark color palette with the hack display mode. No configuration is necessary to use the default skin. Choose a skin style from your site configuration. For example, to set a dark grey color without the stylistic markdown treatment update your config like: config.toml 1baseurl = &#34;https://letterboxd.com/&#34; 2languageCode = &#34;en-US&#34; 3title = &#34;A Scanner Darkly&#34; 4 5[params] 6 description = &#34;An undercover cop in a not-too-distant future becomes involved with a dangerous new drug and begins to lose his own identity as a result.&#34; 7 images = [&#34;https://a.ltrbxd.com/resized/sm/upload/e3/kt/un/fi/nZuqo9yQpEo447sH0w0MFBgdT6J-1200-1200-675-675-crop-000000.jpg&#34;] 8 9[params.hackcss] 10 mode = &#34;standard&#34; 11 palette = &#34;dark-grey&#34; Disable skin styles by setting the disabled flag: [params.hackcss] disabled = true # disable skin styles entirely When changing colors review Custom Styles, Trim Color and Error Page, making any adjustments necessary to achieve the desired look-and-feel.

item.title: Trim Color
item.description: Trim color can sometimes affect how a browser or OS chooses to display borders and accent colors for your site. In Brave, for example, adjusting trim color affects stylizes the location bar. Set a trim color to customize this behavior. The default trim color is automatically set to background color of the currently selected Skin Style. item.content:encoded: Trim color can sometimes affect how a browser or OS chooses to display borders and accent colors for your site. In Brave, for example, adjusting trim color affects stylizes the location bar. Set a trim color to customize this behavior. The default trim color is automatically set to background color of the currently selected Skin Style. Override the default in your Custom Styles by declaring the --trim-color variable inside a :root selector at the top of the file: 1:root { 2 --trim-color: firebrick; 3} Reuse the variable to maintain consistency throughout your custom styles: 4nav a.active { 5 background-color: var(--trim-color); 6} See Using CSS variables for help using CSS variables.
